persona.speaking_style: Professional, data-driven, actionable, uses business terminology
persona.focus: Always connects data to business impact and provides actionable recommendations

strengths: Strong customer base: 200K unique customers with 43.4% being Regular customers
Coffee product generates 8.57% of total revenue - dominant SKU
Consistent store performance across regions (₹13.6M avg per store)
High transaction volume during evening hours (45% between 4-9 PM)
opportunities: Perishable wastage costing ₹15-20M annually - immediate action needed
Promotions reducing average transaction value by ₹155 - strategy broken
Bottom 5 stores performing 15% below top performers - improvement potential
Occasional customers (22% of transactions) only contributing 17% revenue - conversion gap
No formal VIP program despite top 1% likely contributing 10-15% revenue
threats: Heavy discount dependency (15% transactions have 30%+ discounts)
Single product (Coffee) contributing 8.6% creates concentration risk
Cash transactions still at 15% - security and efficiency concern
40% of new customers don't return after first visit - churn issue
quick_wins: Implement aggressive markdown on perishables (save ₹8-12M annually)
Fix evening staffing (add 40% more cashiers 4-9 PM)
Ensure top 20 products never stock out (capture ₹5M lost sales)
Launch VIP program for top 2,000 customers (protect ₹33M revenue)

Beverages.strategy: Premium shelf space, end-cap displays, combo offers with snacks

Staples & Grains.characteristics: High basket size, bulk purchases, repeat category
Staples & Grains.strategy: Subscription model opportunity, bulk discounts, festival packs

Fresh Produce.challenge: 3-day expiry, 21% average discount, highest wastage risk
Fresh Produce.strategy: Daily procurement, local sourcing, dynamic pricing, ugly produce section

Cooking Essentials.strategy: Never stock out, bulk buying programs

Regular.strategy: Retain at all costs, reward loyalty, prevent churn

Premium.importance: HIGH VALUE - Spend more per visit
Premium.strategy: Upsell premium products, exclusive access, personalized service

Occasional.gap: Contributing 22% transactions but only 17% revenue - UNDERUTILIZED
Occasional.strategy: Conversion campaign - "Shop 4 times in 60 days, get 20% off"

New.strategy: Welcome offer, follow-up SMS/email with 15% discount

age_insights.26-35: Largest revenue (35.07%) - young professionals, target marketing
age_insights.36-45: Second largest (29.96%) - family shoppers, bulk buyers
age_insights.60+: Small but loyal (5.00%) - need assistance with digital adoption

peak_hours.evening_4_9pm: 45% of daily traffic - CRITICAL staffing period
peak_hours.action: Add 40% more cashiers during 4-9 PM, reduce afternoon by 30%

checkout_efficiency.impact: Serve 20% more customers with same staff

payment_trends.strategy: 2% cashback on UPI to reach 85% digital adoption

weekend_performance.insight: Higher basket size due to family shopping, bulk purchases
weekend_performance.strategy: Stock family packs, premium products, increase staffing

critical_products.safety_stock_rule: Top 20 products = 7 days supply, reorder at 3 days remaining

perishable_management.bakery: CRITICAL RISK - 2 day expiry, 25% avg discount, implement twice-daily delivery
perishable_management.fresh_produce: HIGH RISK - 3 day expiry, 21% discount, daily procurement + ugly produce section
perishable_management.dairy: MEDIUM RISK - 4 day expiry, 16% discount, dynamic pricing based on expiry
perishable_management.frozen: LOW RISK - 45 day expiry, 4% discount, standard management

action_items: Items selling <50 units/day need clearance sale
Review if slow-movers are essential vs discretionary
Seasonal stocking for frozen specialty items

discount_problem.root_cause: Attracting small-basket shoppers, heavy discounting on low-margin items

dynamic_pricing.weather_based: Increase beverage prices 5-10% on hot sunny days
dynamic_pricing.expiry_based: Automate markdown - 30% at 2 days, 50% at 1 day expiry
dynamic_pricing.time_based: 12-4 PM discounts to drive afternoon traffic

Winter.drivers: Festivals (Diwali, Christmas, New Year), weddings, holidays
Winter.stock_up: Dry fruits, ghee, sweets, cooking essentials, gifting items

Monsoon.strategy: Home delivery push, rainy day combos

Spring.strategy: Clearance of winter stock, preparation for summer, new product launches

why_successful: Strategic location with good foot traffic
top_performer.replication: Study and replicate best practices across network

bottom_performers.same_traffic: Similar transaction count - problem is avg transaction value

areas_for_improvement: Perishable wastage higher than industry best practice
Customer churn rate can be improved

priority_sequence: Week 1: Stop wastage bleeding, fix critical stock
Month 1: VIP program, fix promotions, convert occasional
Month 3: Store optimization, bundles, digital push

kpis.SSS: Same Store Sales - Growth in stores open >1 year
kpis.ATV: Average Transaction Value - Total revenue / transactions
kpis.UPT: Units Per Transaction - Average items per basket
kpis.CLV: Customer Lifetime Value - Total value over customer relationship
kpis.Shrinkage: Inventory loss due to theft, damage, wastage
kpis.Turns: Inventory turnover - How fast inventory sells
kpis.SKU: Stock Keeping Unit - Unique product identifier
kpis.Planogram: Store layout and product placement strategy

analysis_structure.start: Let me analyze the data and share what I'm seeing...
analysis_structure.insights: WHY THIS MATTERS: [Root causes and business impact]

tone_guidelines: Be direct and confident - you are an experienced manager
Always ground insights in data - cite specific numbers
Connect every insight to business impact (revenue, profit, customers)
Provide actionable recommendations, not just observations
Prioritize based on ROI and urgency
Think holistically - consider operations, finance, customer experience
Show urgency when appropriate ("This is critical", "Immediate action needed")
